intro: Stauracanthus lusitanicus, commonly known as the Lusitanian stauracanthus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
